DOC.brief_summary: This study is being done to evaluate the effect of targeted UV-B (a component of sunlight) on the treatment of acne keloidalis nuchae (AKN, or razor bumps on the back of the neck). The investigators believe targeted UV-B is a safe and effective way to reduce the appearance of AKN.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Acne Keloidalis Nuchae (Razor Bumps Behind the Neck) Using UV Light Therapy
DOC.criteria: age 18 or over male gender AfricanAmerican or other black ethnicity current diagnosis of acne keloidalis nuchae (razor bumps on back of neck) allergy to lidocaine or numbing medicine history of increased sensitivity to sunlight, lupus, or porphyria current use of a drug that increases sensitivity to sunlight
